data.title: Sound Advice: 2022 Releases
data.meta_description: List of upcoming theatrical releases on CD, VHS, and DVD.
data.text:
2022 Releases

Also See Upcoming Release Schedule Most Recently Released | 2022 | 2021 | 2020 | 2019 | 2018 | 2017 | 2016 | 2015 | 2014 | 2013 | 2012 | 2011 | 2010 | 2009 | 2008 |2007 | 2006 | 2005 | 2004 | 2003 | 2002 |

December 20, 2022

Harry Connick, Jr.: Make It Merry

(new digital album)

New holiday album, available exclusively on Apple Music in Spatial Audio and iTunes. "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas," "Make It Merry," "Papa Noel," "the Christmas Song," "I Pray on Christmas," "(It Must've Been Ol') Santa Claus," "It Came Upon the Midnight Clear," "Christmas Time Is Here," "On this Christmas Morning," "When My Heart Finds Christmas," "Christmas Day," "Go Tell It on the Mountain," "Jingle Bells."

The Skivvies: Sleigh My Name

(new digital album)

The Skivvies with Randy Harrison, Nick Adams, Leslie McDonel, Nathan Lee Graham, Lindsay Nicole Chambers, and Lesli Margherita. Songs include "Joyful to the World", "Santa's Baby", "Sleigh My Name", "Little Drummer Boy Got The Beat", "Bells Bells Bells!", "Your Body is a Walkin' in a Winter Wonderland", "Fuckin Hannukah", "Toxic", "Christmas Time is Somewhere in my Memory" (available now), "Alcomedley" (featuring Lesli Margherita), "I Touch My Elf" (featuring Nick Adams), "Like a Virgin Proud Mary" (featuring Lindsay Nicole Chambers), "Christmas with a Twist" (featuring Nathan Lee Graham) and Frosty the Snowman" (featuring Leslie McDonel). Joshua Roberts on the drums, Andrew Gutauskas on the woodwinds, Debbie Tjong on bass, keys, background vox, Rob Morrison on guitar, Cearley on vocals, ukulele, bells, glockenspiel and boomwhackers, and Molina on vocals, cello, bells, glockenspiel, and boomwhackers.

December 13, 2022

As You Like It

(Concord Theatricals Recordings - new digital album)

Cast album recording of 2022 Public Works production of As You Like It. Adapted by Shaina Taub and Director of Public Works Laurie Woolery, and featuring music and lyrics by Taub. Ato Blankson-Wood, Brianna Cabrera, Darius de Haas, Bianca Edwards, Rebecca Naomi Jones, Jonathan Jordan, Renrick Palmer, Eric Pierre, Idania Quezada, Christopher M. Ramirez, Shaina Taub. "Prologue: All the World's a Stage," "The Man I'm Supposed to Be," "Rosalind, Be Merry," "The Wrestling Match," "After the Match," "In Arden," "Under the Greenwood Tree," "Will U Be My Bride," "Imagine I'm Your Lover," "You Phoebe Me," "Oh Deer," "When I'm Your Wife," "The Lion & the Snake," "Will U Be My Groom," "For Real," "Getting Married Tomorrow," "Rosalind, Be Merry (Reprise)," "For Real (Reprise)," "You Phoebe Me (Reprise)," "Under the Greenwood Tree (Reprise)," "Still I Will Love," "Epilogue: All the World's a Stage." Released 12/9/22.

Canceling Christmas - A Musical

(new digital album)

Score by Bruce Greer (music) and Keith Ferguson (lyrics) from musical that recounts the story of A.C. Gilbert, (1884-1961) America's greatest toy-maker and the inventor of the Gilbert Erector Set. Arranged and orchestrated by Bruce Greer. 17 tracks. Released 5/31/22.

Carols for a Cure 2022: Volume 22

(Broadway Cares - new digital/on CD)

A welcome return of Broadway Cares/Equity Fights AIDS' seasonal salute to Broadway. Holiday songs performed by the casts of The Music Man, The Lion King, A Strange Loop, Funny Girl and Into the Woods and more. Volumes 1-21 are also still available: Each CD comes with a download of the album. BroadwayCares.org

Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio

(Columbia Records Group - new on CD)

From the 2022 stop-motion musical film from Netflix. Original songs and score from Alexandre Desplat with lyrics by Guillermo Del Toro. The characters are voiced by Ewan McGregor, Cate Blanchett, Tilda Swinton, Cristoph Waltz, and more. "Better Tomorrows" (Ewan McGregor), "Carlo's Theme," "Going to Town," "The Pine Cone," "My Son" (David Bradley), "Spazzatura," "Geppetto's Creature," "Sebastian J Cricket," "A Wooden Boy," "Everything Is New to Me" (Gregory Mann & David Bradley), "Pinocchio," "We Were a King Once" (Christoph Waltz), "Paint Battle," "The Sphinx," "Memory of Carlo," "Fatherland March" (Gregory Mann), "The Circus," "Pinocchio Has Left," "Ciao Papa" (Gregory Mann), "To Catania," "Pinocchio Soldier," "The Late Lamented" (Tim Blake Nelson), "Big Lies," "The Dogfish," "Shoot the Puppet," "Big Baby Il Duce March" (Gregory Mann), "The Mine," "My Bubblegum" (Gregory Mann), "Saving Geppetto," "Pinocchio's Choice." Digital released 12/9/22.

Maxine Linehan: Christmas Candy

(new digital single)

Holiday mash-up of Sia's 2017 hit "Candy Cane Lane" and "It's a Marshmallow World." Released 12/2/22.

The Music Man 2022 Broadway revival cast

(Accidental Jacket Entertainment/Time-Life - new on CD)

Score by Meredith Willson. Cast includes Hugh Jackman, Sutton Foster, Shuler Hensley, Jefferson Mays, Jayne Houdyshell, Marie Mullen, Remy Auberjonois, Gino Cosculluela, Emma Crow, Benjamin Pajak, Kayla Teruel, Garrett Long, Linda Mugleston. "Overture," "Rock Island," "Iowa Stubborn," "Ya Got Trouble," "Piano Lesson / If You Don't Mind My Saying So," "Goodnight My Someone," "Columbia, The Gem of the Ocean," "Seventy-Six Trombones," "Sincere," "The Sadder But Wiser Girl for Me," "Pick-A-Little Scene," "Pick-A-Little, Talk-A-Little / Goodnight Ladies," "Marian the Librarian," "My White Knight," "The Wells Fargo Wagon," "Entr'acte," "Shipoopi," "After Shipoopi Scene," "Pick-A-Little, Talk-A-Little" (Reprise), "Lida Rose / Will I Ever Tell You," "Gary, Indiana," "Lida Rose" (Reprise), "Footbridge Ballet," "Till There Was You," "Goodnight My Someone / Seventy-Six Trombones" (Double Reprise), "Minuet in G" (Curtain), "Finale," "Exit Music," "It's You," "The Sadder But Wiser Girl" (Extended Version). Orchestrations by Jonathan Tunick. Includes digital booklet. Digital released 9/23/22. Released 12/9/22.

The Musicality of Bart

(JAY Records - new on CD/digital)

Collection of songs by Lionel Bart. "Consider Yourself," "Fings Ain't Wot They Used T'be" (Diane Langton and Derek James), "Mums and Dads," "The Land of Promise" (Katrina Murphy), "Maggie, Maggie May" (Graham Bickley and Company), "As Long As He Needs Me" (Josephine Barstow), "Who Is This Geezer Hitler?" (Diane Langton and Company), "Unseen Hands" (Long John Baldry), "The Day After Tomorrow: (Helen Hobson), "So Tell Me Jack" (Josephine Blake), "It's Yourself" (Diane Langton and Graham Bickley), "Oom-Pah-Pah" (Sally Ann Triplett and Company." JAYRecords.com.

Oz and the Musical: Performing the American Fairy Tale

(Oxford Univ Press - Hardcover/Paperback book)

By Ryan Bunch. "The Wonderful Wizard of Oz" (1900) by Frank L. Baum has served as the basis for some of the most popular musicals on stage and screen. Show by show, Bunch highlights the forms and conventions of musical work as practiced in its time and context–such as the turn-of-the-century extravaganza, the classical Hollywood film musical, the Black Broadway musical of the 1970s, and the twenty-first-century mega-musical. He then shows how the journey of each show teaches participants and audiences something about how to act American within contested frameworks of race, gender, sexuality, age, and embodiment. Also explores home theatricals, make-believe play, school musicals, Oz-themed environments, and community events as sites where the performance of the American fairy tale brings home and utopia into contact through the conventions of the musical. 232 pages.

Regina Zona & Sean Harkness: It Must Have Been the Mistletoe

(new digital album)

Opera singer Regina Zona and guitarist Sean Harkness. "Sleigh Ride," "God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen," "Welcome Christmas / Christmas Time Is Here / My Favorite Things," "The First Noel / Silent Night," "Angels We Have Heard on High," "The Christmas Song (Chestnuts Roasting on an Open Fire)," "Home (When Shadows Fall) / I'll Be Home for Christmas," "A Christmas Love Song," "What Child Is This / O Holy Night," "What Are You Doing New Year's Eve," "It Must Have Been the Mistletoe," "Christmas Time of Year." Released 11/1/22.

December 7, 2022

Carl Moellenberg's Story: Broadway and Spirituality as a Path to Survival

(Imagine and Wonder - Hardcover Book)

By Carl Moellenberg. John Shableski, editor. The author's "journey of many transformations: from Midwestern boy most interested in music to a fast-paced Wall Street career; from investment banking to a 12 time Tony Award winner on Broadway; from overcoming several death-defying crises by finding healing, inspiration from a higher being, and deeper spirituality." 224 pages.

Carousel soundtrack

(Del Ray Records - new vinyl)

1956 soundtrack of Rodgers & Hammerstein score. Gordon MacRae, Shirley Jones, Cameron Mitchell, Robert Rounseville, Barbara Ruick, Claramae Turner "Introduction," "Main Title: The Carousel Waltz," "You're A Queer One, Julie Jordan," "(When I Marry) Mr. Snow," "If I Loved You," "June Is Bustin' Out All Over," "June Is Bustin' Out All Over Ballet," "Soliloquy," "Blow High, Blow Low," "When The Children Are Asleep," "A Real Nice Clambake," "Stonecutters Cut It On Stone," "What's The Use Of Wond'rin," "You'll Never Walk Alone," "Louise's Ballet," "If I Loved You (reprise)," "You'll Never Walk Alone (Finale)," "Carousel Waltz" (album version). Restored sleeve artwork & pressed on 180 gram vinyl.

Disenchanted soundtrack

(Walt Disney Records - new on CD/digital)

Soundtrack from 2022 film. Songs by Alan Menken and Stephen Schwartz. Griffin Newman, Amy Adams, James Marsden, Gabriella Baldacchino, Patrick Dempsey, Ann Harada, James Monroe Iglehart, Michael McCorry Rose, Maya Rudolph, Idina Menzel, Alan Menken, Kolton Stewart. "Andalasia," "Even More Enchanted," "The Magic of Andalasia," "Fairytale Life (The Wish)," "Fairytale Life (After the Spell)," "Perfect," "Badder," "Love Power," "Love Power (Reprise)," "Even More Enchanted (Finale)," "Disenchanted Score Suite," "Hard Times for Heroes (Demo)," "Something Different This Year (Demo)," "Love Power (End Credit Version)."

Halfway Bitches Go Straight to Heaven

(TCG - Paperback Book/Kindle Edition)

Play by Stephen Adly Guirgis. 120 pages.

Penelope, or How The Odyssey Was Really Written

(JAY Records - new on CD)

York Theatre original cast recording of score by Peter Kellogg and Stephen Weiner. Britney Nicole Simpson, Philippe Arroyo, Leah Hocking, Cooper Howell, Ben Jacoby, David LaMarr, Jacob Alexander Simon, George Slotin, Sean Thompson, and Maria Wirries. "Prologue," "She's Gonna Be Mine," "The Letter from Aeolia," "The Man That I Married," "Pigs!," "Faint," "Penelope #1," "When I'm King," "No One Will Ever Know," "Penelope #2," "The Letter from Hell," "She's Gonna Be Mine (Reprise)," "Penelope #3," "Home Again," "We Need a Plan," "The Mills of the Gods," "Something in His Touch," "This Moment Is All," "Penelope #4," "Until You Shine," "I'm Not Sure I Remember How," "All Along," "Finale." Orchestrations and musical direction by David Hancock Turner. Digital version released December 2.

Guillermo del Toro's Pinocchio

(Columbia Records Group - new digital album)

From the 2022 stop-motion musical film from Netflix. Original songs and score from Alexandre Desplat with lyrics by Guillermo Del Toro. The characters are voiced by Ewan McGregor, Cate Blanchett, Tilda Swinton, Cristoph Waltz, and more. "Better Tomorrows" (Ewan McGregor), "Carlo's Theme," "Going to Town," "The Pine Cone," "My Son" (David Bradley), "Spazzatura," "Geppetto's Creature," "Sebastian J Cricket," "A Wooden Boy," "Everything Is New to Me" (Gregory Mann & David Bradley), "Pinocchio," "We Were a King Once" (Christoph Waltz), "Paint Battle," "The Sphinx," "Memory of Carlo," "Fatherland March" (Gregory Mann), "The Circus," "Pinocchio Has Left," "Ciao Papa" (Gregory Mann), "To Catania," "Pinocchio Soldier," "The Late Lamented" (Tim Blake Nelson), "Big Lies," "The Dogfish," "Shoot the Puppet," "Big Baby Il Duce March" (Gregory Mann), "The Mine," "My Bubblegum" (Gregory Mann), "Saving Geppetto," "Pinocchio's Choice." CD released 12/16/22.

Roald Dahl's Matilda The Musical

(Masterworks - new on CD)

Soundtrack from Netflix film inspired by the musical. Music and lyrics By Tim Minchin. Original score music by Christopher Nightingale. The film stars Alisha Weir, Emma Thompson, Lashana Lynch, Andrea Riseborough and Stephen Graham. "And So the Great Day Arrived," "The Biggest Burp," "Bruce," "When I Grow Up," "The Most Dangerous Feat," "I'm Here," "The Smell of Rebellion," "The Newt - Stretchy Ears," "Quiet," "Telekinesis," "My HouseThe Truth - Chokey Destruction," "Day of Reckoning," "Magnus Returns," "Revolting Children," "Still Holding My Hand." Released digitally 11/18/22.

Week of November 30, 2022

The American Theatre as seen by Hirschfeld 1962-2002

(The Al Hirschfeld Foundation / Stuart Ng Books - new book)

Edited by David Leopold. Showcases 300 Hirschfeld drawings: his greatest theater work from five decades, including some of the most important productions from the last sixty years, plus portraits of Stephen Sondheim, Neil Simon, Edward Albee, Wendy Wasserstein, Tom Stoppard, and Hal Prince, and more. forward by Michael Kimmelman, and chapter introductions by Brooks Atkinson, Brendan Gill, Maureen Dowd, Terrence McNally and Jules Feiffer. Follow-up to The American Theatre As Seen by Hirschfeld, published in 1961. 250 pages. Available at AlHirschfeldFoundationshop.org.

A Beautiful Noise OBC

(UMe - new on CD)

Cast includes Will Swenson, Mark Jacoby and Robyn Hurder. "Opening Montage," "A Beautiful Noise," "Neil Pitches Songs: I'll Come Running / I Got The Feelin' (Oh No, No) / I'm A Believer (Medley)," "I'm A Believer," "Demo Medley: The Boat That I Row / Red Red Wine / Kentucky Woman (Medley)," "Kentucky Woman," "Into The Bitter End," "Solitary Man," "Cracklin' Rosie," "Song Sung Blue," "Cherry, Cherry / September Morn' (Medley)," "Love On The Rocks," "Hello Again," "A Heavenly Progression," "Sweet Caroline," "Entr'acte," "Brother Love's Traveling Salvation Show," "Play Me," "Forever In Blue Jeans," "Stadium Medley: Soolaimon / Thank The Lord for the Night Time / Crunchy Granola Suite (Medley)," "You Don't Bring Me Flowers," "Brooklyn Roads / America (Medley)," "Shilo," "I Am... I Said," "Holly Holy." Produced by Bob Gaudio. Released earlier digitally.

Darling Grenadine

(new digital album)

Studio recording featuring the 2020 Off-Broadway (Roundabout Under the Radar) cast. Musical by Daniel Zaitchik. Adam Kantor, Emily Walton, Jay Armstrong Johnson, Aury Krebs, Matt Dallal, Mike Nappi. "Prologue," "Swell," "Every Time a Waitress Calls Me Honey," "Party Hat," "I Only See Louise," "Manhattan," "Bottle of Wine," "Suspended," "No Good For Me," "Grenadine," "Every Moon," "Say Something, Paul," "Paradise," "New Year's Eve," "Three Years," "The Kettle Song," "Epilogue." Orchestrations by Matt Moisey. Music direction and additional arrangements by David Gardos. Recorded, mixed and mastered by Dean Sharenow. Recorded at Reservoir Studios, NY and Steel Cut Audio, NYC. Released 11/18/22. BandCamp.com

December Songs for Voice and Orchestra

(P.S. Classics - new on CD)

Maury Yeston's December Songs, sung by Victoria Clark. 37-piece orchestra conducted by Ted Sperling and scored by Larry Hochman. The booklet features complete lyrics, in addition to liner notes by Matthew Gurewitsch. Produced by Bart Migal, Ted Sperling, and Maury Yeston. Digital version released 11/11/22.

Designing Broadway: How Derek McLane and Other Acclaimed Set Designers Create the Visual World of Theatre

(Running Press - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By Derek McLane and Eila Mell. Foreword by Ethan Hawke. Richly illustrated and information-packed celebration of Broadway set design. Many contributors, including John Lee Beatty, Danny Burstein, Cameron Crowe, Ethan Hawke, Moisés Kaufman, Carole King, Kenny Leon, Santo Loquasto, Kathleen Marshall, Lynn Nottage, David Rabe, Ruben Santiago-Hudson, Wallace Shawn, John Leguizamo, and Robin Wagner. With personal sketches and photographs from the artists' archives. 272 pages.

Finale: Late Conversations with Stephen Sondheim

(Harper - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition/Audible Audiobook/Audiobook on CD)

By D.T. Max (The New Yorker). Personal collection of interviews with the late Stephen Sondheim, conducted in the last years of the artist's life (unedited from the February 22 New Yorker article). Audio versions narrated by Christopher Grove and Keith Sellon-Wright. 240 pages.

Footballers' Wives the Musical

(new digital album)

Studio cast album of score by Kath Gotts. Simon Bailey, Liam Doyle, Alice Fearn, Kath Gotts, Chelsea Halfpenny, Emma Hatton, Julie Legrand, Ben Richards, Ashley Samuels, Ivano Turco. "Prologue," "Who, Who, Who?," "Kath Gotts, Alice Fearn & FW Studio Cast Ensemble," "Shrödinger's Frank - Part One," "Shrödinger's Frank - Part Two," "Never Say Die," "Don't Lose It," "Sparks In The House," "Om With Me Now," "Just a Girl Who Loved a Boy," "Shrödinger's Frank - Part Three," "Fairy Tales Aren't Just For Fairies," "Lonely Moon," "Game On!," "Ready to Ride Again," "Shrödinger's Frank - Part Four," "Nurse Nightingale," "Unbelievable."

A Front Row Seat: An Intimate Look at Broadway, Hollywood, and the Age of Glamour

(Univ Press of Kentucky - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By Nancy Olson Livingston. In this memoir, Nancy Olson Livingston treats readers to an intimate, charming chronicle of her life as an actress, wife, and mother, and her memories of many of the most notable figures and moments of her time, including reminiscences of her marriages to lyricist and librettist Alan Jay Lerner and to Alan Wendell Livingston. Interweaves Livingston's life with her observations of the artists, celebrities, and luminaries with whom she came in contact. 408 pages.

Funny Girl

(Sony Masterworks Broadway - new on CD/digital)

New Broadway cast recording. Based on 2022 revival, with some replacements. Lea Michele, Tovah Feldshuh, Ramin Karimloo, Toni DiBuono, Debra Cadona, Martin Moran, Jared Grimes, Kurt Csolak, Justin Prescott, Daniel Beeman. "Overture," "Who Are You Now?," "If a Girl Isn't Pretty," "I'm the Greatest Star," "Eddie's Tap," "Cornet Man," "His Love Makes Me Beautiful," "I Want to Be Seen with You," "Henry Street," "People," "You Are Woman, I Am Man," "Don't Rain on My Parade," "Sadie, Sadie," "Who Taught Her Everything She Knows?," "Temporary Arrangement," "Rat-Tat-Tat-Tat," "Who Are You Now? (Reprise)," "You're a Funny Girl / Beekman Call," "What Do Happy People Do?," "The Music That Makes Me Dance," "Dream Ballet," "Finale Act 2." Released 11/18/22.

Jack in the Box: or, How to Goddamn Direct

(Farrar, Straus and Giroux - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By Jack O'Brien. In a follow-up to his memoir, Jack Be Nimble, the director collects stories from the many productions he has worked on; the great talents he encountered and collaborated with; and the choices that he made, on the stage and off, that have come to define his career. He tells his readers how to become a director–or, at the very least, relates an unfailingly honest story of how he did. 272 pages.

Jane Monheit: The Merriest

(Provident Music Group - new on CD/digital)

New holiday album from jazz/pop vocalist Jane Monheit. "Let It Snow! Let It Snow! Let It Snow!," "The Christmas Song," "That Holiday Feeling," "(Christmas) Stay With Me," "The Merriest" (duet with John Pizzarelli), "What Are You Doing New Years Eve?," "Winter Wonderland," "Christmas Time is Here," "It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year." Released 11/4/22.

Joe Stilgoe: Theatre

(Westway - 2-disc vinyl set)

Deluxe double vinyl version of singer/pianist/songwriter Joe Stilgoe's album, with the Metropole Orchestra. "Overture," "Take Me Back To The Theatre," "Cabaret," "Lost In The Stars," "Does Anybody Have A Map?," "On Broadway," "Mr Matcham," "The King's New Clothes," "Gonna Build A Mountain," "No More/ Nothing's Gonna Harm You/Children Will Listen," "Bring Down The Curtain," "Dad's Lullaby."

María Martínez Sierra: A Great Playwright Hidden in Plain Sight

(Methuen Drama - Hardcover Book/Paperback/Kindle Edition)

Richard Nelson and Colin Chambers, editors (also contribute an essay on the translation work of the Granville-Barkers). Harley Granville Barker and Helen Granville Barker, translators. The introduction by Patricia O'Connor examines María's extraordinary life and work, and the battle for her authorship to be recognized in both the Spanish-speaking and anglophone world. Edited collection of three plays by María Martínez Sierra: The Kingdom of God (1928); The Romantic Young Lady (1920) and Take Two From One (1931). 248 pages.

One Public: New York's Public Theater in the Era of Oskar Eustis

(Methuen Drama - Hardcover Book)

By Kevin Landis. Presents the broader organization, its creative methodology, and its enormous growth over the past 20 years. Tells the contemporary story, recorded over many interviews with iconic practitioners and performers ranging from Diane Paulus, Tony Kushner and Lynn Nottage to Kevin Kline, Chelsea Clinton and Lin-Manuel Miranda. Case-study driven, One Public uses oral history accounts and authorial experience to illuminate The Public Theater, Eustis and their cultural influence on the city of New York and the greater United States. 336 pages.

Penelope, or How The Odyssey Was Really Written

(JAY Records - new digital album)

York Theatre original cast recording of score by Peter Kellogg and Stephen Weiner. Britney Nicole Simpson, Philippe Arroyo, Leah Hocking, Cooper Howell, Ben Jacoby, David LaMarr, Jacob Alexander Simon, George Slotin, Sean Thompson, and Maria Wirries. "Prologue," "She's Gonna Be Mine," "The Letter from Aeolia," "The Man That I Married," "Pigs!," "Faint," "Penelope #1," "When I'm King," "No One Will Ever Know," "Penelope #2," "The Letter from Hell," "She's Gonna Be Mine (Reprise)," "Penelope #3," "Home Again," "We Need a Plan," "The Mills of the Gods," "Something in His Touch," "This Moment Is All," "Penelope #4," "Until You Shine," "I'm Not Sure I Remember How," "All Along," "Finale." Orchestrations and musical direction by David Hancock Turner. CD to be released December 9.

Ramin Karimloo: The Road to Find Out - North

(Westway Music - new EP CD)

Third in the series. "Driftwood," "Music of the Night," "I Vow to Thee My Country," "When Does It Go Away," "Once Upon a December," "Androgynous."

Streisand: The Mirror of Difference

(Wayne State Univ Press - Hardcover Book/Paperback)

By Garrett Stewart. The author "notes the gender and ethnic stereotypes that Streisand shattered as the first openly Jewish superstar, while concentrating not just on the cultural difference she made but on the internal differentials of her unholy vocal gift-whose kinetic volatility shapes a kind of cinematic terrain all its own." 252 pages.

Weeks of November 15 - 22, 2022

Ballad of Dreams the Musical

(new digital album)

Concept album for musical by Allyson Hernandez. With Elizabeth Bedley, Randall Scott Carpenter, Amanda Ferguson, Olivia Gjurich, Jeremy Konopka, John Jeffrey Martin, Fiona McArthur, Devon Perry, Nicholas Rodriguez, Robb Sapp. Released 11/11/22.

The Bestest Office Christmas Party Ever

(new EP)

Selections from new holiday musical with score by Billy Recce (music and lyrics) and Drew Larimore (lyrics). Mary Testa, Paige Turner, Deb Radloff, Jamen Nanthakumar, Bryan Munar, DeAnne Stewart, and Ryan McCurdy. "Opening: Bestest Office Christmas Party Ever," "Santa for Me," "Bitch Face David," and "Sex Machine Robot."

Christmas At Birdland (Deluxe Edition)

(Club44 Records - new digital album)

Previously released album with four more tracks. Billy Stritch, Jim Caruso, and Klea Blackhurst. New tracks: newly recorded "Jingles the Christmas Cat," "Old Days, Old Times, Old Friends," and "We Need a Little Christmas"; plus an "Orchestra Mix" of the original album track "It's the Holiday Season," with special guest Donny Osmond. Steve Doyle on bass, Daniel Glass on drums, and Dave Koz on saxophone. Released 11/11/22.

Colin Donnell & Patti Murin: Something Stupid

(Broadway Records - new on CD/digital)

"House of the Rising Sun," "And I Will Follow," "Jackson," "The Next Right Thing," "Because the Night," "Meadowlark," "I See the Light," "Finishing the Hat," "How Do You Keep the Music Playing / My Funny Valentine," "America," "Everything Changes," "Something Stupid." Produced by Robbie Rozelle, and co-produced by Yasuhiko Fukuoka. Arrangements and orchestrations by Luke Williams.

Knoxville

(Broadway Records - new on CD)

Asolo Repertory Theatre cast recording of score by Stephen Flaherty and Lynn Ahrens. Based on James Agee's "A Death in the Family." Cast includes Jason Danieley, Hannah Elless, Paul Alexander Nolan, Ellen Harvey, Nathan Salstone, and Joel Waggoner. Released 11/11/22. Digital released 10/21/22.

Los Fantastikos

(Stage Door Records - new on CD)

CD debut of the 1961 Mexico City Cast Recording of Tom Jones and Harvey Schmidt's The Fantasticks. Adapted by Luis de Llano and Martha Fischer. Armando Calvo, Maria Rivas, Antonio Gama, Ortiz de Pinedo and Guillermo Orea. Includes: includes two songs recorded by Christian Bratt (original 1962 Stockholm production); three Swedish cover recordings from the score; four pop cover recordings as sung by Harry Belafonte (in English). 25 tracks. Limited pressing of 500 units only. StageDoorRecords.com.

Northern Star

(new digital album)

Concept album of score by Jared Alexander. With Lorna Baxter, Rhian Ferrigan, Feifei Xiang. Orchestrations and arrangements by Eoin Corcoran. northernstarmusical.com.

Roald Dahl's Matilda The Musical

(Masterworks - new digital album)

Soundtrack from Netflix film inspired by the musical. Music and lyrics By Tim Minchin. Original score music by Christopher Nightingale. The film stars Alisha Weir, Emma Thompson, Lashana Lynch, Andrea Riseborough and Stephen Graham. CD to be released 12/9/22.

Sondheim Unplugged: Volume Three

(Yellow Sound Label - new 2-CD set/digital)

Third in series. 42 tracks. More than 40 performers, including Harris Doran, Rob Maitner, Jim Walton, Sally Mayes, Karen Mason, T. Oliver Reid, Ken Jennings, Sarah Rice, Claybourne Elder, Telly Leung, among others. Produced by Phil Geoffrey Bond. Music direction and piano, Joseph Goodrich. SondheimUnplugged.com.

Spirited

(Republic Records - new on CD)

Soundtrack from the Apple Original Film. Original songs by Benj Pasek and Justin Paul performed by Will Ferrell, Ryan Reynolds, Octavia Spencer, Patrick Page, Sunita Mani, Andrea Anders, Marlow Barkley. "Christmas Morning Feelin'," "Present's Lament," "Bringin' Back Christmas," "The View From Here," "The Story of Your Life (Marley's Haunt)," "Good Afternoon," "The Story of Your Life (Clint's Pitch)," "Unredeemable," "The View From Here (Riverwalk)," "Do A Little Good," "That Christmas Morning Feelin' (Curtain Call)," "Ripple (Cut Song)."

A Strange Loop

(Hal Leonard - new paperback book)

Vocal selections songbook for Broadway musical by Michael R. Jackson. Arranged for vocal line with piano accompaniment. "Boundaries," "Didn't Want Nothin'," "Exile in Gayville," "Inner White Girl," "Intermission Song," "Inwood Daddy," "Memory Song," "Periodically," "Precious Little Dream / AIDS Is God's Punishment," "Second Wave," "A Strange Loop," "A Sympathetic Ear," "Today," "Tyler Perry Writes Real Life," "We Wanna Know." 136 pages.

Week of November 8, 2022

Almost Famous The Musical - 1973 Bootleg EP

(Masterworks Broadway - 12" vinyl disc)

Four songs from Almost Famous the musical. Score by Tom Kitt, with some lyrics by Cameron Crowe. Limited edition package. Chris Wood, Anika Larsen, Solea Pfeiffer, Drew Gehling, Casey Likes, Rob Colletti, Matt Bittner, Chad Burris, Gerard Canonico, Julia Cassandra, Brandon Contreras, Jakeim Hart, Van Hughes, Jana Djenne Jackson, Katie Ladner, Danny Lindgren, Erica Mansfield, Alisa Melendez, Emily Schultheis, Daniel Sovich, Libby Winters, and Matthew C. Yee.

Arthur Miller: American Witness (Jewish Lives)

(Yale Univ Press - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition/Audible Audiobook/Audiobook on mp3 CD format)

By John Lahr. An original interpretation of Miller's work and his personality ... Organized around the fault lines of Miller's life–Miller's family, the Great Depression, the rise of fascism, Elia Kazan and the House Committee on Un-American Activities, Marilyn Monroe, Vietnam, and the rise and fall of Miller's role as a public intellectual. Demonstrates the synergy between Arthur Miller's psychology and his plays. Concentrating largely on Miller's most prolific decades of the 1940s, 1950s, and 1960s, Lahr probes Miller's early playwriting failures; his work writing radio plays during World War II after being rejected for military service; his only novel, "Focus"; and his succession of award-winning and canonical plays. 264 pages.

Carefully Taught: American History through Broadway Musicals

(Applause - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By Cary Ginell. Looks at American history as depicted in forty Broadway musicals. Categories include: biographies of famous Americans, (Andrew Jackson and Fiorello LaGuardia), stories with national conflicts (Hamilton, South Pacific), events that captured the attention of the American public (Floyd Collins, Newsies), and sociological studies or satires of specific eras (The Music Man, Hair). Approaches American history from two vantage points: the point of view of the playwright and composer accompanied with the context of how these events were seen when they were produced versus how they are seen today. 284 pages.

My Own Directions: A Black Man's Journey in the American Theatre

(McFarland - Paperback Book)

By Sheldon Epps. "... the unique story of how the author came into leadership at Pasadena Playhouse after a successful career directing on Broadway, in London and at theatres all over the world. In intimate detail, it relates how the theatre was radically changed and reignited by his leadership, including his insistence on making diversity a priority both onstage and off. It is the very personal story of a person who wanted his race to be recognized, but never used as a limitation or a reason to be less than fully respected. In many ways, this memoir tells the story of what people of color in America must face repeatedly to make their lives matter." 153 pages.

Opera: The Definitive Illustrated History

(DK - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition/Audible Audiobook)

By Alan Riding and Leslie Dunton-Downer. Follows the history of opera from Monteverdi's L'Orfeo in 1607, to Cosi fan Tutte, La Bohème, and modern operas such as Brokeback Mountain. Explains musical terminology, traces historical developments, and sets everything in a cultural context. Features include: all of the most important operas from the Renaissance to the 21st century; profiles of the key composers, librettists, performers, and companies, with details of their lives, works, and influence–arranged in chronological order to show the evolution of the genre; explanations of musical terminology and different types of opera. 360 pages.

The conversations include designers (30 in all) who are commercially successful, artistically successful, and those who have existed on the fringes of the theatre world whose work is not necessarily definable, and therefore not as visible. 268 pages. Transforming Space Over Time: Set Design and Visual Storytelling with Broadway's Legendary Directors

(Applause Books - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By theater designer and Tony Award winner Beowulf Boritt. Tells the stories of six diverse productions: five on Broadway and one Off-Broadway ... beginning with the moment he was offered each job, and taking readers through the conceptual development of the set, in collaboration with the director, the challenges of its physical creation, and the intense process of readying it for the stage. Extensive conversations with the directors of the productions ... such as James Lapine, Kenny Leon, Hal Prince, Susan Stroman, Jerry Zaks, and Stephen Sondheim. 304 pages.

Fiddler's Journey to the Big Screen

(Zeitgeist Films - new Blu-ray)

2022 documentary on making the film version of Fiddler on the Roof. Captures the humor and drama of director Norman Jewison's quest to recreate the lost world of Jewish life in Tsarist Russia and re-envision the beloved stage hit as a wide-screen epic. From filmmaker Daniel Raim. Narrated by Jeff Goldblum. Draws on behind-the-scenes footage and never-before-seen stills as well as original interviews with Jewison, Topol (Tevye), composer John Williams, production designer Robert F. Boyle, film critic Kenneth Turan, lyricist Sheldon Harnick, and actresses Rosalind Harris, Michele Marsh, and Neva Small (Tevye's daughters). Special Features: The Man on Lincoln's Nose, Daniel Raim's Oscar-nominated short about production designer Robert F. Boyle, featuring Norman Jewison; additional interviews with John Williams, Topol, Rosalind Harris, Neva Small, and Sheldon Harnick; film researcher Lillian Michelson on the undergarments used in Fiddler (excerpt from Harold and Lillian: A Hollywood Love Story). The Letters of Oscar Hammerstein II

(Oxford Univ Press - new hardcover book)

Mark Eden Horowitz, editor. Hundreds of previously unpublished letters that show off all facets of Hammerstein's many engagements and his personality: correspondence to and from major Broadway figures like Richard Rodgers, Stephen Sondheim, Jerome Kern, and Josh Logan, as well as those with politicians and activists. Reveals a man who was sharp, opinionated, and funny but also cared deeply about addressing the social ills that his musicals explored beyond the stage. 1000 pages. Kindle version released 4/18/22.

Grease, Tell Me More, Tell Me More: Stories from the Broadway Phenomenon That Started It All

(Chicago Review Press - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

Edited by Ken Waissman, Adrienne Barbeau, and Tom Moore. How the show that started in a converted trolly barn in Chicago in the Eden Theatre February 14, 1972, short of money, short of audience, short of critical raves ... became a musical classic. Collection of memories and stories from over one hundred actors and musicians, including the creative team and crew who were part of the original Broadway production and in the many touring companies it spawned, including Barry Bostwick, John Travolta, Adrienne Barbeau, Treat Williams, Marilu Henner, Peter Gallagher, Danny Jacobson, Walter Bobbie, Jerry Zaks, Laurie Graff, John Lansing, Ilene Kristen, Ilene Graff, and Lisa Raggio. 352 pages.
